186019289.review:
Got the game for the Zombies mostly (so i will comment on that topic)
Honestly if you are looking on a introduction to zombies mode this is the game for you. Hundreds of Custom Maps for you to play besides the basic in-game ones, with really easy installation. The game at its core is quite "light" so even people with low-end PCs can run it smoothly. 
Honestly for its price it will give you countless hours of gaming so i would say a really worth purchase option.
The only downside i can think of is if you are not a Zombies fan, the campaign isn't something out of the ordinary (at least for me ofc)
Other than that i would say a hard 9/10 as a game, and what it provides you with.

Still remains as the last great call of duty ever made, I love this game to my very core seeing as it was my first call of duty game back in 2010 and man it was a shocker growing up.

就算放到现在也很能打的老游戏！第一次玩还是高中时期在网吧玩到的，可以说是我的青春回忆了。

COD5几乎可以说是开辟了二战剧情游戏的先河，优点在于战役模式气氛紧张，武器很全，从东线的MP40到太平洋的加兰德几乎都有，丧尸模式太吓人所以没敢玩.....

美中不足的就是没中文，AI太笨总喜欢挡瞄准视线(还有国会大厦的逆天手雷雨) ，太平洋关卡设计太单调重复，而且多人匹配几乎全是阴间服了

总的来说，如果是二战迷或者《使命召唤》系列的忠实粉丝的话，这款游戏绝对值得收藏，支持正版不会后悔！！！^^

185468536.review:
Birçok açıdan farklı bir COD deneyimiydi. Öncelikle bana kalırsa müzikleri en iyi COD oyunu diyebilirim. Her bölüme özel müzik yapmışlar. E bu da oyun deneyiminin kalitesini kat be kat arttırıyor. Silah çeşitliliği de gayet tatmin ediciydi. Özellikle nadir silahları komutanlar kullanıyor gibi bir mantığa oturtmuşlar ve böylece diğer sıradan silahlardan daha az bulabiliyoruz bunları. Unique silahlar da gerçekten diğerlerinden daha etkili. Bu da oluşturdukları sistemi mantıklı hale getirmiş. 

  Hikaye klasik 2. dünya savaşı. Amerika ve Sovyetler Birliğinden karakterlerle oynuyoruz. COD oyunlarındaki efsane karakterlerden Reznov da hikayede yer alıyor. Bence gayet güzel ve akan bir oyun. Nispeten kısa olduğu için de 1-2 oturuşta bitirebilirsiniz.

185347402.review:
Перепроходил Call of Duty: World at War много раз. А впервые прошёл на тачпаде. После очередного завершения всех 15 миссий могу сказать, что игра по-прежнему топовая. Очень хорошо передана атмосфера Второй Мировой Войны. Ещё раз кайфанул от кампании за СССР, Дмитрия Петренко и Виктора Резнова, который ещё сыграет пару ролей в серии игр Call of Duty. Если вы об этом не знали и когда-то давно ограничились прохождением только относительно старых проектов франшизы, то советую заглянуть в Black Ops. 
Короче говоря, всеми любимая 5 часть. 
Прошу любить и жаловать. 
 
P.S. сложность Ветеран обычная для игр CoD тех лет. Противники очень резкие и не промахивающиеся. Чтобы заканчивать перестрелки необходимо всё время продвигаться вперёд, тогда противник будет отступать.

185340748.review: 以前最低难度通关过，这次最高难度打完，作为一个平时不怎么玩FPS游戏的人，感觉半条命都丢了……。游戏有着强烈的历史感，细节也比较丰富，战场氛围强烈，缺点就是它臭名昭著的“手雷雨”，相信每一个玩最高难度的人都深有体会。另外看得出来，制作组似乎已经很尽力以正面形象塑造苏联兵了。虽然因为苏联曾经干过的坏事儿我对苏没什么好感，但玩到最后看到他们撤下纳粹旗，拼命挂上镰刀锤子旗还是挺激动的，大概是对执着、信念人类这种美好品质本身的感动吧。

185218625.review: This game was an insane campaign experience! This game does a GREAT job of capturing the dark and ruthless side of war. Each mission has this dark feel to it that keeps reminding you there's enemies all around you trying to kill you. The characters you're on these missions with are likable and admirable for their bravery. They're fighting through one of the scariest wars in history if not the scariest. These game included war boats, fighter planes, explosives being thrown every where, flamethrowers, and all sorts of different gorilla warfare tactics. This game also introduced the zombies game mode for the first time. The game comes with all four zombie maps and oh boy this mode is fun! There wasn't anything this scary yet so fun to play with friends at the time. Anyway overall you're getting a great experience with this game.

185143494.review:
The BEST Call of Duty to date. This game presents an amazing story of WWII from two perspectives. A soldier in the Red Army pushing west into Germany and a soldier in the American Army pushing north up the Pacific Islands towards Japan. This game has guts unlike many of the other COD games. There is historical accuracy, more realistic gore than modern COD games somehow, and an ambience that really captures the dark feel that should come with a WWII game. 

The fact that this game is brutally honest and uncensored is what made it last throughout the years and the reason why there is so much hate for modern COD games today. I have yet to find someone who says World at War is bad but it seems like every second person I ask about the newest COD games says they're terrible.

184934686.review:
A fun, but difficult game!

So, I played this game on my Steam Deck, and I must say, this game really isn't suited for it. I couldn't beat it even on Regular with the controls. It's amazing how much better I was when I tested it with a Controller+Mouse. I was playing a lot better and having more fun. 

Regardless, this was my first Call of Duty game in about 8 years. I enjoyed the campaign a lot, even if it was difficult to get through.  I had some bugs however while playing the game, where I had to repeat a level because it softlocked during a mission, but aside from that, it was clean throughout. I had the most fun playing as the Russian, and it was really cool putting up the flag at the end of the story.

In terms of gameplay, it's fun on the lower difficulties, but the grenades can be brutal. Don't expect to be able to beat this game on Veteran. I tried it one of the later levels, and there was a time where 7 grenade indicators were on my screen. 

Zombies is fun as well, even if it is not the reason I bought the game. This game has a large amount of fan-made maps for COD Zombies, so if you are interested in that, you should probably give this one a go.

I didn't play any of the multiplayer because it doesn't interest me. So I can't give an opinion on it.

Overall, if you just want to shut your brain off and shoot some guns, this game is for you. Just don't pay full price for it. The game is already too expensive for something that came out 17 years ago.

184671170.review:
After the mud and blood of the Lightning Warfare in 1940,Unstoppable German war machine is beset by the cold winter and sheer quantity of Russian Forces.Meanwhile Japan's invasion of China has become a meat grinder because of the non existent supply stiuation in the West of Nanjing.Dreams of Empire and Total Domination is slowly fading for the Axis forces and the Tripartite Pact.

 It's surprising that we seldom see WWII stories from the Russian and Japanese side.They all focus on American Marine's saving France and liberating the Low Countries.But this is the greatest Call of Duty campaign to ever exist and of course we start in Stalingrad and play as Liutenant Reznov and from the Eastern Front we go all the way to Berlin,destoying and liberating.

 Besides the Russian campaign,Invasion of the Japanese Islands are fun.Mision "Burn em out" allways comes to my mind when i talk about this with friends.You're in the deep jungle and yeah you have equipment and supply but deadly Japanese code is unstoppable and you have to get through hell of Iwo Jima to survive.

 Overall,the gameplay didn't age very well because of technological innovations of the modern gaming era however World at War is still amazingly fun to play and reminisce the good old.There are no censorship stuff which i respect and feels like back in the day entertainment sector in the US was more free and liberal in the words' truest senses.This should be teached as a lecture to Activision of today who's been focusing making Call of Duty a woke Fortnite in these days.

184580767.review:
Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟 (4/5)
"Call of Duty: World at War – Une immersion brutale dans la Seconde Guerre mondiale."

Call of Duty: World at War, développé par Treyarch, reste un classique incontournable pour les fans de la franchise Call of Duty et les passionnés d’histoire de la Seconde Guerre mondiale. Ce jeu offre une expérience brutale et réaliste, avec des combats intenses, des personnages mémorables et un excellent mode multijoueur qui a encore aujourd’hui une place spéciale dans le cœur des joueurs.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Une ambiance immersive et brutale :
World at War vous plonge dans des batailles violentes et impitoyables de la Seconde Guerre mondiale. La guerre dans le Pacifique et sur le front de l’Est est retranscrite de manière réaliste, avec des décors, des armes et des ennemis fidèles à l’époque. Le jeu réussit à capturer l'horreur de la guerre, tout en offrant une action intense.

✅ Des campagnes mémorables :
Le jeu propose deux campagnes principales : l'une suit un soldat américain dans le Pacifique, l'autre un soldat soviétique en Europe de l’Est. Ces histoires, bien que simples, sont percutantes et pleines d'émotion, avec des moments forts qui marquent le joueur.

✅ Une immersion dans les environnements dévastés :
Les environnements sont à couper le souffle. Des jungles pacifiques aux ruines de Berlin, chaque carte respire l’histoire de la guerre. Les détails sur le terrain de bataille, les explosions et la violence des combats rendent chaque mission palpitante.

✅ Le mode Zombies :
Un des ajouts les plus mémorables de World at War est l’introduction du mode Zombies, qui deviendra un pilier de la franchise. Survivre à des vagues infinies de morts-vivants dans un manoir est aussi fun que terrifiant, et le mode a rapidement gagné une base de fans fidèle.

✅ Un gameplay solide et classique :
Le gameplay de World at War reste fidèle aux standards de la franchise. Le système de visée et de couverture est efficace, les combats sont fluides et l’utilisation des véhicules et des armes lourdes ajoute une dose supplémentaire d’intensité.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Un manque de variété dans les missions :
Si l’immersion et la tension sont au rendez-vous, certaines missions peuvent devenir répétitives, avec des objectifs similaires d’une carte à l’autre. Cela nuit légèrement à la diversité de l'expérience.

⚠️ Des IA ennemies un peu prévisibles :
Les ennemis, bien que coriaces, ne sont pas toujours très intelligents et peuvent devenir prévisibles, ce qui rend certaines sections du jeu moins tendues.

⚠️ Une campagne courte :
La campagne solo peut se terminer relativement rapidement, ce qui peut décevoir ceux qui attendent une expérience plus longue. Heureusement, le mode multijoueur et le mode Zombies offrent une belle durée de vie.

⚠️ Des graphismes un peu datés :
Bien que les graphismes aient été impressionnants pour l'époque, World at War commence à montrer son âge, notamment au niveau des textures et des animations des personnages. Toutefois, cela n'enlève rien à l’immersion.

En conclusion :
Call of Duty: World at War reste un épisode marquant de la saga, offrant une expérience immersive et brutale dans l’une des périodes les plus tragiques de l’histoire. Grâce à sa campagne palpitante, son mode Zombies novateur et son multijoueur solide, il a su se faire une place de choix parmi les meilleurs titres de la franchise Call of Duty.

🎮 Verdict final :
Un jeu incontournable pour les fans de Call of Duty et de la Seconde Guerre mondiale. Si vous aimez les missions intenses, les zombies et les batailles épiques, ce jeu est pour vous.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé :

Campagne principale : 6 à 8 heures.
Multijoueur et Zombies : 20+ heures pour découvrir tout le contenu.
✨ Note personnelle : Un jeu d’action brut et excitant, avec une atmosphère et un gameplay qui continuent de plaire aux joueurs, même après toutes ces années. Si vous êtes fan de guerre moderne et d’histoires percutantes, World at War vous emmènera dans un tourbillon de batailles.

184573319.review:
Call of Duty World at War

Call of Duty: World at War is an outstanding entry in the Call of Duty series that delivers a gritty, immersive, and unforgettable World War II experience. From its compelling campaign to its groundbreaking multiplayer modes, this game excels on multiple fronts.

The single-player campaign stands out for its intense and cinematic portrayal of historical battles. Set across the Pacific and Eastern Fronts, the game captures the brutality of war with remarkable attention to detail. The voice acting, particularly from talents like Kiefer Sutherland and Gary Oldman, adds depth and authenticity to the narrative. Each mission is well-paced and offers a variety of gameplay, from storming beaches under heavy fire to stealthy nighttime infiltrations.

Multiplayer is where World at War truly shines. The progression system, weapon customization, and map designs are top-notch, offering endless replayability. The introduction of the now-iconic Zombies mode adds an extra layer of fun and challenge, making it a fan-favorite addition that has influenced future titles in the series.

The graphics and sound design, for its time, are remarkable. Explosions are visceral, environments are destructible, and the soundtrack perfectly complements the high-stakes action. The game effectively immerses players in the chaos of war, leaving a lasting impression.

Overall, Call of Duty: World at War is a masterpiece that stands the test of time. Whether you're a fan of historical shooters or simply enjoy high-quality action games, this title is a must-play. It balances historical authenticity with engaging gameplay, making it a landmark in the franchise.

Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)

184182783.review:
Resumen: Recomendado 

Call of Duty: World at War no es solo un videojuego, es un referente en la historia de los shooters bélicos y, para mí, una experiencia personal inolvidable. Desde las primeras partidas en la PS3, este juego marcó una etapa de mi vida en la que compartí intensos momentos con mi padre. En cada misión, en cada enfrentamiento, descubrí no solo una historia llena de tensión y heroísmo, sino también un vínculo especial que solo puede nacer a través del compañerismo en el campo de batalla virtual.

Con el tiempo, el salto a Steam me permitió revivir esta obra maestra y explorar el increíble mundo de los custom maps en Zombies, donde conocí a personas que compartían la misma pasión. Juntos enfrentamos desafíos que pusieron a prueba nuestra habilidad y estrategia, creando momentos que quedarán grabados para siempre.

Pero más allá de las anécdotas personales, World at War destaca por uno de los personajes más memorables de toda la saga: Viktor Reznov. Su presencia imponente, su voz cargada de emoción y su inquebrantable determinación lo convierten en una figura legendaria. Reznov no es solo un soldado, es un líder que inspira, un hombre que personifica el sacrificio y la lucha por la justicia en medio del caos de la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Cada interacción con él, cada discurso, es un recordatorio de por qué este juego sigue siendo tan icónico.

Si te gustan los juegos con una narrativa impactante, personajes inolvidables y acción intensa, Call of Duty: World at War es una experiencia que debes vivir. Es un título que marcó mi vida, y estoy seguro de que puede marcar la tuya también. Lo recomiendo sin dudarlo.

Zombies is still fun but I guess there are better alternatives nowadays. (8.7/10)

The campaign is a masterpiece. I didn't play the multiplayer but I keep coming back to the campaign every 2 years since it came out. You play as the Americans in Japan and as the Russians that take the battle from there homeland too the third reich. 

This games has balls on how it depicts war. The Japanese just banzai your ass and you will never forget "URAAA", the cry of victory from the russians. The game really takes you to a gritty place, a place that you'll wish never to experience in real life. The game is full of little details and Reznov is just a beast. Take your time to let the game sink in and take your time while your playing, to look around. The missions are so cool and as the story progresses, the personalities and behaviour of the soldiers change also. They don't make them like this anymore.

Also back in the day when you finished the campaign for the first time and you unlocked the new zombie mode for the first time was just insane. A new mode that kept the series going strong until now. This game is a masterpiece in all aspects and if you didn't play it, than do it!

10/10 Best game of my childhood and still beats lots of games even from today's generation. 
A total classic. So ahead of its time. 

Campaign : Amazing dark campaign, if you liked Black Ops 1 then you will enjoy this one as it is probably the game that inspired it. Much darker too.

Zombie Mode : Comes with the 4 OG maps that created the very begining of the Classic Zombie mode. Do I really need to say more ?

Multiplayer :  If what you are looking for is the multiplayer.. unfortunately most of the lobbies are either empty or filled with bots and XP Glitches. Still there are some normal severs left but very few. I heard there's an alternative for the Multiplayer side with Plutonium, which would probably have more servers. But I was still able to enjoy it without Plutonium this very morning !

PLUS: If you ever get bored there are plenty mods that you can download for the Zombies mode from community creators. Lots of custom maps to choose from on Nexus Mods.

With all this taken into consideration, it was still very worth it to me. I find it a bit pricey for a 17 year old game but still, I am totally happy I bought it.

183884139.review:
[h1]A haunting masterpiece that we will never see the likes of again[/h1]

Call of Duty is an interesting series to me because Call of Duty: Finest Hour for the Xbox was one of the first games I remember playing. Call of Duty 2 and Call of Duty: Modern Warfare are stand outs in the series but, one Call of Duty game stands above them all and that's Call of Duty: World at War.

Call of Duty: World at War is my favourite of the entire series, it's a horrific, haunting take on WW2 in a time where WW2 FPS games were massively oversaturated. The entire tone is excellent and the soundtrack is masterfully woven into the gameplay and atmosphere. World at War is about the chaos, wastage and death of the biggest war in human history while also still being a shooting gallery intended for entertainment. Everything about WaW is grim and I love it, its bloody, gory and pulls no punches. WaW is also just an incredibly entertaining game that has held up remarkably well, the graphics and animations have held up really well where as the crusty sound design has definitely aged a bit. The soundtrack however is still excellent, I cannot stress enough how epic yet haunting the soundtrack is, it just has so many layers to it and it fits into the gameplay perfectly.

The great thing about Call of Duty: World at War is that its easy to recommend because its easy to play and understand. You shoot stuff and it go boom. Sadly WaW is the only one we will ever get because they never made another like it, it is truly unique even to its own series. 

[i]As a side note this game is exceptionally difficult on Veteran, especially if you want to 100% it[/i]
https://youtu.be/5Dta0rRvHow?si=y_ySe6wm4YKxD-C2

[b]That CoD rant you've heard a million times before:[/b]
Call of Duty nowadays is a complete joke. In my unpopular opinion the series nose dived with the release of Black Ops 1 and became a multiplayer focused joke, it steered away from big, epic simulated battles and went toward awful character driven 'special ops' gameplay that was heavily scripted. Call of Duty died a long time ago and started catering to the lowest common denominator, it is extremely depressing to me when somebody claims that Black Ops 1 was the 'good old days' of CoD campaigns. CoD and games in general nowadays have lost all their grit and historical accuracy (not that WaW is particularly accurate) which is why WaW is a gem from when the industry wasn't being coerced by people like Sweet Baby Inc and the HR department.

183879168.review:
If I played this back when it was released, it would have undoubtedly blown me away. The first few hours are the most immersive - it is a very gritty, no-fluff kind of portrayal of war that I never experienced in other games. Instead of having a full arsenal of weapons and machinery, you are forced to conserve ammo and scavenge across the map to have a chance at survival. Your squad mates are dying left and right like it's a normal thing (granted, like 5 of them died because I shot them on accident), your enemy advances with undying fervor and in a seemingly infinite string of people, and you are forced to sit in a bleak environment of a jungle or a destroyed city, where every shade merges into each other, forming the gray mess of the environment. Even on the normal difficulty, the game is unforgiving: without proper positioning and precise shots, as well as quick thinking, you have no chance of advancing. The air filled with shouts of men, machine roars and whistle of bullets. It is beautiful in its grotesque-ness.

I did not play this game in childhood, so rest assured that my opinion of it is not clouded with nostalgia. With that in mind, the game did not age too well. The difficulty here often stems from the fact that it is not very clear what to do: sometimes you have to eliminate a set number of enemies to progress, other times you need to advance to a different location to continue or the enemies will spawn infinitely. The gun play, albeit good, gets pretty stale after a while, with every gun being assigned to one of three classes: sniper rifle, smg or handgun (useless). Also, the game is relatively short: if you wanted to, you could complete it in 4-5 hours. And finally, I would have loved to see more story. The characters are memorable, but mainly 'cause what they say, not what they do. What they do is always the same: kill bad guys -> die -> win. 

Although I am not a fan of action shooters, I still enjoyed this. This game is a result of an era back when big game studios actually tried to make something groundbreaking, and it shows.

183668734.review:
I only play the campaigns in CoD, and World at War is, to me, one of the most underrated campaigns in the franchise. It’s gritty and brutal, but above all, it brings a level of epic scale that’s hard to match. The Red Army’s final push against Germany feels like a wave of raw vengeance—just crashing forward again and again until there’s nothing left. The campaign alternates with the last days of the Pacific theater, in battered islands and thick jungles where every inch of ground is drenched in the desperation of japanese defense to the death. Both fronts feel bleak and unyielding, yet completely different in atmosphere.

I love how unstoppable you feel during these final assaults. Each firefight feels intense... whether it's in a hunt like in Stalingrad, a precise military operation as in the first pacific battles or an unstoppable glorious push, There’s a weight behind everything you do that pulls you right into the conflict and the intended atmospheres which chain just right. The Stalingrad mission starting among the corpses with the motherland suffering from the german assault is a perfect prologue to the final assault. 

The weapons in World at War feel fantastic, too. Strong—mighty, even, which fits perfectly with the game’s tone. From the M2 Flamethrower to the BAR, most of the arsenal feel super satisfying to use. The settings are also pretty rare for CoD and even overall for a shooter, covering everything from bleak pacific outposts, european countryside, trenches, a devastated Berlin to grim jungle warfare and bleak Pacific outposts. Usually, you’d expect vibrant tropical islands, but here it’s all scorched beaches and desperate defenses, with sunsets that feel more like it's a showdown than beautiful. The attention to historical detail is spot-on as well. For example, seeing Japanese soldiers with glasses late in the war nods to how everyone got mobilized in a last-ditch effort, even those previously excluded for poor eyesight aligned with the desperate "BANZAIII charges".

Reznov is a magnificent bastard who drives home the feeling of vengeance and victory at all costs as part of an unstoppable human wave. He gives you the desire to push for the win no matter the costs, with no quarters given.  

World at War has aged like fine wine. Back when it came out, it was overshadowed by the brilliance of CoD 4: Modern Warfare, but looking back on it now—especially compared to some of the latest releases—it’s easily one of the strongest campaigns in the series.

There are flaws though; the friendly AI can be unbelievably dumb at times, blocking you when you’re trying to escape a grenade and causing you to die invevitably. There are also some terrain glitches, and the older engine can be a real headache. I have to run the game in safe mode and readjust the graphics every time I launch the game, because if I don’t, it defaults to 600x800 resolution—and in an already dated engine, that turns into an unplayable pixel mess.

Still, even with those issues, World at War delivers one of the best campaign experiences CoD has to offer. It nails that perfect balance between feeling epic and mighty without going overboard. The storylines are grounded in real WWII battles—no stupid scenarios with Russia invading Europe in one day or South America defeating US, no gimmicky mechanics either, nothing to break immersion—something that’s been missing in newer CoD titles. It captures the brutal glory of WWII victory, their land, their people, their blood!

183516135.review: Why no achievements on pc? Either way I just replayed the campaign and It is still one of the best single player experiences I have had. I love how it goes through the different battles and wars between the two main characters. Similar to layout of first couple games but it has it's own unique story that makes it so much more interesting. The M rating was definitely needed for these games too. Not to mention the zombies which started my favorite side mode of all time which turned into my favorite game mode period. Multiplayer was great too obviously it's just dead now.
